meanings.definition: A North American antelope with distinctive branching horns.
meanings.sent1: The pronghorns grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of pronghorns running across the field.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pronghorns always win at hide and seek? Because they were always a-antelope!
meanings.sent4: The pronghorns' horns resembled a beautiful tree with many branches.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the pronghorns with their unique horns was truly captivating.

meanings.definition: The fastest land animal in North America.
meanings.sent1: Speedy pronghorns sprinted across the plains.
meanings.sent2: The pronghorns easily outpaced all other animals in the race.
meanings.sent3: The pronghorns challenged the cheetah to a race, claiming they were the real speedsters!
meanings.sent4: Watching the pronghorns run was like witnessing a blur of motion across the land.
meanings.sent5: The pronghorns' speed was unmatched, making them the true champions of the plains.

meanings.definition: A species of ungulate found in the western United States.
meanings.sent1: The pronghorns roamed freely in the vast western landscapes.
meanings.sent2: Many wildlife enthusiasts travel to see the pronghorns in the western states.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pronghorns throw a party in the desert? Because they wanted to hoof it up!
meanings.sent4: The pronghorns' presence in the western United States added to the region's natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The graceful pronghorns were a symbol of the untamed wilderness in the western states.
